Malaysian meaning: a member (of a group) (when the word is used by itself) (from Arabo-Persian "ahli" اهلی 'belonging to a group  people  indigenous or sim.')  expert in a field (from Arabo-Persian "'aqli" عقلی 'belonging to the intellect or mind  intellectual')

Indonesian meaning: me / I (Used by speakers from Sumatra mainly Malays  people in Medan  etc)  crew (of transportation)
specific to 'Father' (God) in religious context (Christianity) our Father which art in Heaven = Bapa kami yang di surga Father in Indonesian is bapak (with an additional 'k' letter')

Malaysian meaning: to treat  giving something for free
Indonesian meaning: to shop (note: also carries this meaning in Malay  though in a context more akin to "spend".)
to make love  have sexual intercourse

Malaysian meaning: From the root word "edar" which can means; to oscillate (planets only)  to leave  or to distribute

Indonesian meaning: can/be able to (also understood but less frequently used in Malay) (same as "boleh" in Malay)  venom
tail ('ekor' as commonly used in Malay  sometimes in Indonesia)

Malaysian meaning: suggestion  opinion  proposal (example: peti cadangan = suggestion box) Indonesian:saran
Indonesian meaning: reserve  spare (example: ban cadangan = spare tire)
(to call) someone who can not keep a secret (example: mulutnya comel= her mouth can't keep a secret)

Malaysian meaning: A preposition that carries 5 meanings; 1. from (to explain the origin of something) 2.than (to do comparison) 3.from (to protect from  to avoid from ) 4. from (to state the sender of something) 5. from (to state the differences)
Indonesian meaning: than (comparison)(example: Kamus ini lebih baik daripada yang itu= This dictionary is better than that one)
doctorate (educational title) In Indonesian  the equivalent for medical doctor is dokter

Malaysian meaning: to sit  a place to live on (only used informally)
bastard from 'anak gampang' lit. easy child.

Indonesian meaning: frugal  pennywise  save money or something e.g. electricity  gas or water usage

Malaysian meaning: frugal  pennywise  save money or something e.g. electricity

Indonesian meaning: ber-kacak pinggang (stands with hands on your hips) The Malay equivalent is bercekak-pinggang  a phrase to mean that a person is being bossy
elder sibling (either elder brother or sister)

Malaysian meaning: or kafan: Muslim burial shroud (kain kafan/kapan)
Indonesian meaning: when (kapan mau pulang?= when do you want to go home?)
to work (karyawan= workers) result of work Karya seni=work of art to create a piece of art.

Malaysian meaning: government (historical association  most Malay states were governed by monarchs  from Raja = King  now refers to any kind of government)
'bola keranjang' = basketball (no other use than for basketball)

Indonesian meaning: vehicle  carriage  cart (kereta api = train  kereta kuda = horse carriage/cart  kereta gantung = cable car)

Malaysian meaning: A soft solid made by incorporating a medicinal substance or substances with sugar  sirup  or honey
Indonesian meaning: clothing industry  any fancy or luxurious women's clothes (Dutch: confectie. A non-standard spelling sometimes used is: "konveksi")

Malaysian meaning: to disturb  to stir Indonesian: mengaduk

Indonesian meaning: mathematic operational symbol  police operation  operation/surgery (as in Dutch)
packet  package (normally used for promotion purposes  as in Dutch)

Malaysian meaning: plan (associated with architectural work  site map etc. only)

Indonesian meaning: high-rank officer/officials (those who hold office  Malay (pegawai))
lawyer (but it has nothing to do with its root word acara which means an event or a TV program in both languages)

Malaysian meaning: free of charge percuma can also mean free of charge in Indonesian  but its usage has become obsolete  replaced by cuma-cuma/gratis (taken from Dutch: gratis=free)
standard; correct bahasa piawai = standard language
bugs (software bugs i.e. Year 2000 bug and also commonly referring to the bed bugs)
tree  to plea or to beg (from basic word: "mohon")

Indonesian meaning: essential  basic  main kebutuhan pokok = essential necessities
fertilizer (also means 'to nurture' in the metaphorical sense of the word)

Malaysian meaning: to go around a place  circular in motion  to spin/rotate Indonesian: putar

Indonesian meaning: in nonstandard usage: "impolite"  "pornography-related"[31][32] gambar seronok = porn picture
vice (for example  'vice chancellor' and 'vice president')  representative
